checks.description: Verify navigation to Daily Wage Calculation page from Settings > Payroll
checks.selector_hint: breadcrumb or page title containing 'Daily Wage Calculation'
checks.assertion: Page should be accessible via Settings > Payroll > Daily Wage Calculation path

checks.description: Verify calculation basis options are available (calendar days, working days, custom days)
checks.selector_hint: radio buttons or dropdown for calculation type selection
checks.assertion: At least three calculation basis options should be selectable: calendar days, working days, custom days

checks.description: Verify salary components selection controls are present
checks.selector_hint: checkboxes or multi-select for salary components
checks.assertion: Salary components selection interface should allow choosing which components to include in calculations

checks.description: Verify system acknowledges varying month lengths in calculation
checks.selector_hint: help text, tooltips, or remarks about month-specific calculations
checks.assertion: Documentation or UI should indicate that calculations vary by month length (31 days in January, 28 in February, etc.)

nav.canonical: Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure

checks.description: Verify navigation to End of Service eligibility configuration
checks.selector_hint: breadcrumb or page title containing 'End of Service' and 'Configure'
checks.assertion: Page should be accessible via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure

checks.description: Verify salary component selection for leave encashment (Basic Only vs Basic + Allowances)
checks.selector_hint: radio buttons or dropdown for salary component selection
checks.assertion: Should offer at least two options: Basic Only and Basic + Allowances

checks.description: Verify calculation method options for end-of-service (calendar days, working days, custom days)
checks.selector_hint: radio buttons or dropdown for calculation method
checks.assertion: Should provide options for calendar days, working days, or custom days calculation methods

checks.description: Verify ability to configure specific leave types for end-of-service calculations
checks.selector_hint: checkboxes or list of leave types with configuration options
checks.assertion: Interface should allow configuring individual leave types for end-of-service calculations

checks.description: Verify override indicator showing which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten
checks.selector_hint: warning message, badge, or visual indicator near leave type configurations
checks.assertion: Super admin should see indication of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten

checks.description: Verify navigation to Daily wage calculation settings for proration
checks.selector_hint: breadcrumb or page title containing 'Daily wage calculation'
checks.assertion: Page should be accessible via Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation

checks.description: Verify calculation bases available for proration (custom days, calendar days, working days)
checks.selector_hint: radio buttons or dropdown for calculation base selection
checks.assertion: Should offer custom days, calendar days, and working days as calculation bases

checks.description: Verify warning or notice about rejecting/resaving prorated transactions when payroll month is open
checks.selector_hint: alert message, warning banner, or informational text
checks.assertion: When payroll month is open with prorated transactions, system should indicate need to reject and resave transactions

nav.canonical: Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method > day calculation type

checks.description: Verify navigation to leave policy unpaid leave configuration
checks.selector_hint: breadcrumb or page title containing 'Leave Policies' and 'Unpaid Leave'
checks.assertion: Page should be accessible via Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method > day calculation type

checks.description: Verify override indicator showing payroll daily wage calculator takes precedence over leave policy formula
checks.selector_hint: greyed-out formula field, disabled state, or override message
checks.assertion: Formula field should show visual indication (greyed-out, disabled, or message) that payroll settings override this configuration

checks.description: Verify messaging about payroll configuration precedence over leave policy
checks.selector_hint: help text, tooltip, or informational message near formula field
checks.assertion: Should display message explaining that payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence

nav.canonical: Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method > day calculation type

checks.description: Verify navigation to leave policy configuration for unpaid leave
checks.selector_hint: breadcrumb or page title containing 'Leave Policies' and 'Unpaid Leave'
checks.assertion: Page should be accessible via Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option

checks.description: Verify override indicator showing global configuration supersedes policy-level settings
checks.selector_hint: greyed-out fields, disabled state, or override notification
checks.assertion: Should display visual indication that global unpaid leave daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific settings

checks.description: Verify explanation of configuration hierarchy and override mechanism
checks.selector_hint: help text, tooltip, or informational message
checks.assertion: Should explain that global configuration takes precedence over policy-level customization

nav.canonical: Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure

checks.description: Verify navigation to End of Service configuration for proration display
checks.selector_hint: breadcrumb or page title containing 'End of Service eligibility'
checks.assertion: Page should be accessible via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure

checks.description: Verify daily rate is displayed in UI (e.g., basic + allowances / 30 formula)
checks.selector_hint: text field, label, or remarks section showing daily rate calculation
checks.assertion: Daily rate formula or calculated value should be visible in the configuration interface

checks.description: Verify remarks or notes section displays pro-rated calculation information
checks.selector_hint: remarks field, notes section, or informational text
checks.assertion: Should display remarks or notes about how pro-rated amounts are calculated

nav.canonical: Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method > day calculation type

checks.description: Verify navigation to leave salary calculation configuration
checks.selector_hint: breadcrumb or page title containing 'Leave Policies' and 'calculation method'
checks.assertion: Page should be accessible via Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method

checks.description: Verify override indicator showing policy-driven calculation precedence
checks.selector_hint: greyed-out fields, disabled state, or override message
checks.assertion: Should indicate that leave salary calculation is driven by policy configuration and may override other settings

checks.description: Verify information about daily rate divisor (30 days, 31 days, etc.) is displayed
checks.selector_hint: help text, tooltip, or remarks about divisor configuration
checks.assertion: Should display or explain the daily rate divisor used in calculations (e.g., 30 custom days)

nav.canonical: Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method > day calculation type

checks.description: Verify navigation to unpaid leave configuration with remarks display
checks.selector_hint: breadcrumb or page title containing 'Unpaid Leave' and 'calculation method'
checks.assertion: Page should be accessible via Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method

checks.description: Verify remarks field displays daily rate and number of days used in calculation
checks.selector_hint: remarks section, text field, or informational display
checks.assertion: Remarks should show the daily rate value and the number of days used (e.g., '925.81 based on 31 days' or '989.66 based on 29 days')

checks.description: Verify remarks accurately reflect calendar days for the month (including February leap year handling)
checks.selector_hint: remarks text showing day count
checks.assertion: Remarks should display correct number of calendar days for the month (28/29 for February, 30/31 for other months)

nav.canonical: Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option > calculation method > day calculation type

checks.description: Verify navigation to leave policy configuration for daily rate display
checks.selector_hint: breadcrumb or page title containing 'Leave Policies' and 'Unpaid Leave'
checks.assertion: Page should be accessible via Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Add new policy > Unpaid Leave option

checks.description: Verify daily rate displayed is the stored rate from leave occurrence month, not recalculated from payroll month
checks.selector_hint: remarks field or daily rate display showing stored value
checks.assertion: Daily rate shown should be the initially calculated rate from the leave occurrence month, not recalculated based on payroll processing month

checks.description: Verify daily rate remains consistent across payroll cycles
checks.selector_hint: remarks or display field showing daily rate value
checks.assertion: Daily rate should remain consistent and not change based on different payroll processing months
